page.title: 13THE DISUSED RAILWAY 2
page.content: Since the track of the Lewes to Uckfield Railway was taken away ithas become an{interesting and popular walk especially along the embankment where there is a good view of the country- side around.{Children make great use of this, playing on the remains and the bridges. There are many wild flowers and in autumn blackberries. There are{old crossing keeper's and {signalman's houses at Hamsey.}One has been{converted and extended,}the other is being rebuilt at the moment. In 1983 one of the small stations to the north of this block at Isfeild was bought by the Milham family. They have restored it and renamed it the {Lavender Line. On Sundays steam {engines run}and the public may now come and ride on a short section of track for no charge.
